comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Commonwealth War Graves Commission list following BURNS, ROBERT Rank:Private Service No:18808 Date of Death:01/07/1916 Regiment/Service:Royal Scots 16th Bn. Panel ReferencePier and Face 6 D and 7 D. Memorial THIEPVAL MEMORIAL They can be found here www.cwgc.org/search-for-war-dead/casualty/762032/BURNS,%2...

comment.author: 77235581@N00
comment._content:
Robert Burns lived at 85 Comely Bank, Edinburgh, according to his Army Service record. He enlisted on 19 December 1914, when he was 34 years and 4 months of age, putting the date of birth at around August 1880. His occupation is surveyor; he stood 5 ft 6 ins tall. Robert was married to Elisabeth Thompson of 13 Athole Crescent, Edinburgh on 10 September 1915. 

Robert was reported missing on 1 July 1916, but not declared dead until May 1917. His wife was allotted a pension of 12s. 6d. (65p) per week. Although his ID disc was forwarded to Elisabeth, she was not prepared to accept that her husband was dead - she felt he was still living according to a letter from August 1916.
